creator: dmitryr@visto.com
text:
Class not found exception happens arbitrary for any class from directory web-
inf/classes, if the servlet defined as load-on-startup. There is no simple 
reproduce test, because number of classes should be pretty high. For one class 
servlet the problem never happen. The problem usually happened after restarting 
server, because some classes were already cached by OS and timing diagram was 
changed. Tomcat used in standard configuration without external web server.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
Either the current code fixed the problem or I can't reproduce it.

I tested with 4 copies of Slide (with the JARs unpacked), with the WebDAV 
servlet loaded on startup. This should load quite a few classes, and the class 
repository contains about 200 classes. I tried launching TC a few times in a 
row, and it worked fine.
Were the number of classes you were using greater than this ?

I tested with a fast CPU (Athlon 900) with Win2k and JDK 1.3.0_02.

I'll mark the bug as "works for me".
